question: Question_07_(b)
statement:
Two drink makers Hard and Soft compete for customers. Each year 20\% of
Hard$^{\prime}$s customers shift to Soft and 30\% of Soft$^{\prime}$s
customers shift to Hard. Assume that this year the drink makers have
equal market share.

What will be the market distribution in the distant future?
sols:
Solving for eigenvalues $\displaystyle \lambda_{1}=1,  \lambda_{2}=0.5$.
We have \emph{n} linearly independent eigenvectors so we can use Power
Method. The eigenvector for $\displaystyle \lambda_{1}=1$ is
$\begin{bmatrix} 1.5\\1  \end{bmatrix}$. We need to scale the vector
into a market share vector

$ANS = \begin{bmatrix} .6\\ .4 \end{bmatrix}$
